trial_identification.studytitle: Prospective study investigating relation between preoperative quality of sleep with anesthetic requirements
trial_identification.scientifictitle: comparing anesthetic drugs requirements in preoperative poor quality sleepers versus good quality sleepers undergoing elective surgery

interventions.interventions: evaluation of preoperative sleep quality using sleep electroencephalogram EEG for 8 hours on the night before surgery, recording induction dose of propofol needed to achieve bispectral index BIS value 40-60, recording intraoperative isoflurane requirements needed to achieve BIS 40-60 every 3 minutes
interventions.comparator: Comparing intraoperative anesthetic requirements in good sleepers versus bad sleepers. Patients are classified according to EEG findings as follows: 1.Total sleep time:good sleepers 6-8 hours, bad sleepers less than 3 hours 2. Slow wave sleep %: good sleepers 25-30%, bad sleepers less than 12% 3. Rapid eye movement sleep %: good sleepers 20-25%, bad sleepers less than 10%

primaryOutcome.outcome: Preoperative sleep quality using preoperative sleep EEG
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The night before surgery for 8 hours interval

primaryOutcome.outcome: Induction dose of propofol mg/kg needed to achieve BIS value 40-60

Recording intraoperative isoflurane inspired concentration needed to achieve BIS index 40-60 every 3 minutes. Intraoperative isoflurane concentration will be measured using anesthetic gas analyzer attached to ventilator breathing circuits.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and every 3 minutes till the end of surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Intraoperative hemodynamics: Non invasive blood pressure measured by automated cuff Heart rate measured by intraoperative ECG
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and then every 10 minutes till the end of surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Postoperative pain and analgesic requirements. This is a composite outcome
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: VAS score at the end of surgery then every 4 hours till 24 hours postoperative. Pethidine 1 mg/kg will be given if VAS more than or equal 4. Total pethidine requirements will be calculated for each patient.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: ASA physical status 1 and 2, Body mass index BMI 25-30, Normal sleep wake pattern, Patient with Epworth sleepiness scale scores less than 5, patients scheduled for elective open cholecystectomy, open upper abdominal hernia mesh repair, male patients only due to cultural obstacles to sleep EEG measurements.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of sleep disorders e.g. insomnia, Addiction, History of intake of any drug that affects sleep cognition e.g. antidepressants.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Sleep disturbances are common among surgical patients in the preoperative period due to anxiety. Since general anesthesia and physiological sleep share many similarities, the aim of this study is to examine the relation between preoperative quality of sleep and intraoperative anesthetic requirements and postoperative analgesic requirements.
